original_title: Sri Lanka to allocate 10 Mn USD for solar projects for Buddhist temples
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers have approved a proposal to amend an agreement between Sri Lanka and India so as to allocate 10 million US dollars out of a 15-million-dollar grant to provide solar power facilities to Buddhist temples and piriven schools.
The original memorandum of understanding (MoU) between the two countries was signed in March 2022 to implement projects under the grant to strengthen bilateral relations with respect to Buddhism.

In November 2022, India’s High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Gopal Bagley met with Minister of Budhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, Vidura Wickremenayake to expedite Buddhist projects that were funded with grants.

“As we have allocated this 10 million dollars, we aim to provide a solution to the problem of increasing electricity bills to religious places,” cabinet spokesman and Minister of Media Bandula Gunawardena said. (Colombo/Jul22/2023)
